ratings.comment: Lectures were in person but could be done online, so most students just did them online. They are "super" lectures, so they're 75 minutes twice a week. I had Morgan Robinson for a TA and she was very smart but could be cocky. Prof Kaiser was kind of a weird guy and said some strange things in his lecture. I recommend this class for a comm B credit

Good professor but never really interacted with him since all grading is done by the TAs. Rarely went to lectures and still did very well in the class, just make sure to attend discussions as that's where the more important things happen. Homework is extremely minimal, but grading is slightly tough sometimes. Overall a good class for gen eds.

The material for this class can be challenging, but the lectures really bring all of the information together. It is clear that Professor Kaiser is truly interested in the material and extremely knowledgable about each topic we discuss, I definitely recommend!

Dr. Kaiser's class was an utter waste of time. Its exceptionally boring and only provides insights into his personal philosophy. I wish I had taken a different class. If you want an easy A though, he's your guy.

I took this class a year ago, and Kaiser is a great professor. Lectures are kind of long but they are actually pretty interesting. I enjoyed the class, but do your best on the papers and exams because those 4 things are pretty much all of your grade. Overall I thought he was great and I was happy I took the class.

Not a bad lecturer, but really lets his personal politics come into his work and the class. Everything is presented from a marxist viewpoint and never speaks about the benefits that have been created in the modern world. Lots of work and the grades are done 'holistically' which means "if I like you, you get an A." Basically political science.

Discussion-based lectures. High-level thinking and discussions based on readings (some theory) each week, worth considering nonetheless. Open my eyes to a lot on the subject. Would definitely recommend taking classes with Kaiser, might suggest waiting to take this until later in college careers.

His class had very interesting points about the current world, but he puts it in a very bland way that makes you want to fall asleep in class. Getting an A is hard in his class if you do not go to lecture and read. There are two large papers and two tests that are the majority of your grade. Having a good TA is key as I learned by having a bad one.

One of my most engaging and enjoyable courses taken thus far. Content was very interesting but sometimes repetitive across units (as to be expected). There were discussion posts, two exams, and a final project, but grading definitely wasn't too harsh. Show up to class and participate, and you should do well. There's even some movies for homework.

Robert's lectures are long but the topics are very interesting, I leave class feeling like I learned something new every time. He is a great professor, very smart and seems excited to teach during lectures.

I'm currently taking 101 and am very disappointed to see that I still don't have a single grade in as we are more than halfway through the semester, We've turned in an assignment, one essay, and an exam and I've received no feedback on anything and we are past the drop deadline.

I took this class in fall 2017 as a Comm B course, and I liked the premise and material of this class, but lectures were often boring, repetitive, and loaded up too much information on one slide. I would say this course wasn't too difficult if not for the papers. If you have a good TA it really helps.
The course is relatively easy but its pretty boring. The material is very repetitive. The topic is interesting but I almost feel like all his lectures could be done in one three hour symposium.

Very interesting course! Loved the fact that we took time to talk about current events as they popped up - super relevant. The professor is a great guy, makes jokes, loves his subject, and very willing to hear ideas and answer questions. Could get away with not doing a majority of the reading. 2 easy papers and 2 written exams, fairly easy.

This class was amazing. It was super interesting, and It really changed how I think about the world. The professor is funny, and I didn't have any problems with his grading. Lecture is important because he often summarizes the readings and movies.
This class was a lot more interesting than it sounds. I didn't have to study very hard for this class because I went to all of the lectures and discussions.

I loved the class! Kaiser did a great job giving lots of information in an interesting way, and did a good job interacting with the class as opposed to just talking to himself the whole time. Geo101 is definitely the CommB class to take.

Decent professor- seemed to repeat much information in lecture which made them pretty boring. Easy enough class- 3 essay exams and 2 research essays.  Not graded to hard. He really likes examples on his exams, so doing the assigned readings can be helpful (not the actual human geo book).

Robert is really knowledgable professor and his lectures are easy to understand. He has a lot of passion for the subject. If you go to the lectures and do the required work its easy to get a good grade. Assigned readings are helpful but not necessary all the time. No textbook required for this course.
Three written tests, two essays. Weekly reading outside of class. Very knowledgeable and enthusiastic about topics. The lectures can be long.

Robert is awesome. This is probably my favorite class I've taken here and definitely the best Comm B to take. Some TAs suck, so I switched TAs to the best TA I've had for any class ever, and he just further enhanced the class. There's three blue book exams and two papers and they're graded easily.

Great professor, makes the subject matter very interesting, and gives me a desire to learn.  Class was easy, with simple readings and watching movies being the main homework, with 2 take home essays, and 2 written exams.  I maybe did half of the readings, but still did fine.   All around good class.

Bob was my favorite professor this last semester! He has a very interesting, well thought-out world viewpoint for the class. I really liked the class discussions about current events related to geography, like the Syrian Migration Crisis. The class was easy to follow and organized in a clear way. He has a good really sense of humor too.

Grading on exams and papers were very critical. Lectures are interesting and Kaiser is passionate about his work. Not too bad of a class. I didn't particularly enjoy the research papers, speeches, or essay exams though.

Bob is really knowledgeable but lectures can get really long, we were behind a lot. but overall fairly easy class, only two tests but also two papers. Take the class if you enjoy the content, not for comm b credit
Very clear lectures and passionate about human geography. Cared about student interest and understanding.
Class is pretty much common sense. Anything you say is correct as long as you have some semi-articulate justification. The two papers assigned are a pain in the ass.

HORRIBLE. This is the most boring class I've taken at UW. Professor talks nonstop about Estonia. Lectures are SO long (or at least they seem that way). Not that difficult. Two tests. Two papers. A lot of dumb section assignments. I would not recommend. This was the worst 150 minutes week. I got an A though.

DO NOT take for Comm B. This class is was to much work for the comm b credit, there are many other ones you could take. The lectures are long, and the material makes it even longer. If you can't write fast, type the notes cause he loads up the lecture and goes through slides fast--and they are not put online. Only 2 tests tho which is nice.

Kaiser is a pretty average professor. He's definitely wonky, so he's smart, but his teaching style is boring - I fell asleep in his class twice. Loads tons of information onto his PowerPoints to the point where it's impossible to take notes without a laptop. Hope you have a good TA for this class because if you don't, you're taking a grade hit.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS FOR COMM B.  Way too involved for what it should have been.  TA's grade ridiculously hard.  Class essay exam were not too difficult.  I found it hard to maintain an A/B all semester and really never knew what my grade was till the end of semester.  Lectures will bore you to death lol

WORST TEACHER. Yes, while he is very passionate about what he teaches, he is the least helpful teacher ever. Things were going ok in my class until a crisis erupted in the country he studies, when he basically through the syllabus out the window,and lost all control and ability to organize the class. Repeatedly interrupts students who are talking.

Professor Kaiser is obviously vary passionate about geography.  He does his best to make the class interesting, and he ties in current events to the lecture material.  Both exams are written, so grading is subjective, and the two papers total to around 15 pages combined.  Professor Kaiser makes learning about geography interesting.

Professor Kaiser is the least straightforward professor I have ever had. His class lacks structure and he provides little to help providing the class with what the main ideas are. He moves extremely fast during lecture and doesn't post his notes online. If you're planning on taking this class, study with a group. Good Luck

Meh, it was an easy class, but some of the material just makes no sense whatsoever.  This class reminded me of my freshman poetry class, rambling about things that sound good are better than knowing anything about the subject matter.  Geopolitics is not a real field.  Nice guy but the class becomes tedious and boring 2 months in.

Great class, great professor! History and current events tie together smoothly. Lecture can be entertaining, two tests and two papers (easy).  He's an expert on Soviet Union/Russia/Eastern Europe, and very knowledgeable about the rest of the world.  Recommend!

Great professor, very nice and explains everything in detail. If you go to class and pay attention 80% of the time you will get A no prob. Don't take this class if you're not interested in IR and currents events. He is not pompous or arrogant at all. Graduating senior, one of my favorite classes at UW. Also, no stupid busywork at home.2papers2tests
One of best classes I've ever had at the university.
Great class.  The material is quite interesting, and Kaiser knows what he's talking about.  He's a nice guy, and very helpful.  Watched a lot of awesome movies.  The perfect summer course.

I have to agree with the student who said that he thinks he's God. He is a very smart guy and knows his material very well. However, he is very rude and unfriendly. If he does not like you, he will treat you very badly. Short-tempered and moody

Thinks he's God. I liked the course, the readings, everything, until the professor humiliated me, maliciously one day in class in front of my peers.  I was sick with Crohn's Disease, I can't remember now if this was before or after I had several feet of intestines removed.  Megalomaniac! Not worth it, I can do the readings on my own! Ego!
Kaiser is one of the worst professors at UW.  He does not care about students who are interested in his class and will lie to them

Very interesting class about geopolitics - a lot of material dealing with current global issues (terrorism, economic crisis). He's an engaging professor and very straightforward. Take this class, you'll love it.

Fantastic professor! I had him for 101 and 318, and while 101 was a lot of work, it wasn't difficult. Just stay on top of it. 318 analyzes a lot of movies/video clips/speeches. As long as you show up for lecture and pay attention you'll do fine.  He hands out study guides for the 2 exams, and practically outlines papers for you in his prompts.
Readings are not mandatory as long as you attend class and write down everything he has on his powerpoints. Grading is not tough. Expect to rely on TA's to fully understand concepts.

This class is a Comm B. course, so expect to write a lot.  The papers aren't very difficult, as you get to choose your topic most of the time.  The TA's grade pretty easily, and he gives out study guides for the exams.  The discussion activities are pretty pointless, but aren't hard.  Don't worry about reading the book, tests are all on lectures.
He definitely loves what he is teaching; however, I did not. Even though I wasn't interested in the material his tests were pure memorization.

GEOG 318 is a political geography class, pretty much an overview of the history of the field and its theories. If you're into this sort of thing, the professor is quite knowledgeable. However, he repeats and retreads the same material a lot. Lectures tend to be pretty dull, but the readings are interesting (although superfluous).

For everyone ****ing about the work, please.  While there was a lot of work, it was very easy.  Little studying required since most of the class is common sense if you have half a brain.  The oral debates are a joke, you end up speaking for like 3 minutes.  TAs are awesome in the class.  Professor is approachable and knows what he's talkin about.
this is a lot of work for a 3 credit class, especially for a 101 level...

This class sucks. i thought it would be the easiest class, but do not take it. it is so much work. debates and essays and tests pretty--- one or the other every week. 2 five page papers, one 8 page paper, 2 exams, and 2 oral debates. Have fun!

Goes through slides really fast so all your notes are scribbles but it is important to write what he has written. 2 essay exams. Class wouldnt be so bad if it wasnt a comm B course. Goes over some pretty interesting topics and doesnt use vocabulary that is over your head.
No Comments
Sometimes I swear he changes topics mid sentence.
The wrist hurt at times because of all the writing but the material he teaches he does very well and the course is interesting.
Boring to tears but an easy class.
